page.title: 14HOME LIFE
page.content: In conversation with residents of Burton Lazars the overall impression gained is one of gradual change sometimes for the better and sometimes not.Physical changes include the building of new houses,the renovation of old ones and the deterioration of some of the roads. It seems that although Burton is still surrounded by farmland most of the working residents travel to nearby Melton or further afield to work.There is little employment in the village. The village was described as "friendly" and "alive" thanks to both villagers of short and long standing. For many residents the Church plays a large part. Activities include gardening, flower arranging and table tennis clubs but there was a feeling that there could be more for young adults.
